results.title: Cell 1
results.brief_description: This video aims to give insight into the structure of cells, showing mutual as well as divergent characteristics of bacterial (procaryotic) and human (eukaryotic) cells. The structure and function of DNA, RNA and proteins are explained. Basic cellular proceses, the structure of the macromolecules, and the three-dimensional conformations are shown in computer generated models. Sutiable for Secondary level students.

results.title: Celine et Julie Vont En Bateau = Celine and Julie Go Boating
results.brief_description:
This is an adventure in narrative fiction involving two pairs of heroines and an old dark house in a fairytale that spins around both the protagonists and the audience. One pair (Ogier and Pisier) forms a phantom triangle with a widower in the house of fiction that Berto and Labourier enter. What ensues is a strange, hieratic tragedy borrowed from Henry James. Rivette’s film is in turn magical, joyous and unsettling and, at times, all three at once, a journey through the movie experience itself, an exhilarating display of parodies and genre pastiches forming what amounts to a meditation on the art of illusion. The four female lead actresses collaborated to the writing of the script. Jacques Rivette won the Special Prize of the Jury at the Locarno International Film Festival (1974). Further viewing: ‘Daisies’ (1966) directed by Vera Chytilova [2081701, VHS], from which Rivette took inspiration for ‘Celine and Julie’. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Barbet Schroeder ; director: Jacques Rivette ; writer, Eduardo de Gregorio ; photography, Jacques Renard ; music, Jean-Marie Senia ; editor, Nicole Lubtchansky.
Cast: Juliet Berto, Dominique Labourier, Bulle Ogier, Marie-France Pisier, Barbet Schroeder.

results.title: Celine and Julie go boating = Celine et Julie vont en bateau
results.creator_credit: Jacques Rivette, Barbet Schroeder and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description: A brilliantly allusive meditation on the nature of fantasy, imagination and magic this seminal film is regarded by many as Rivette’s most accomplished film. The narrative, spinning a tortuous, circular fantasy out of reality, using correspondences, premonitions and transferences as its mortar, is absolutely riveting: weird and wonderful, scary and funny in equal measure. A compulsive shaggy dog story, the real importance of the film is the way it demonstrates exactly how cinema works through an exhilarating display of parodies and genre pastiches. Cast includes Juliet Berto, Dominique Labourier, Bulle Ogier and Marie-France Pisier.

results.title: Celebrity
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Jean Doumanian, Magnolia Productions and Sweetland Films BV
results.brief_description: Kenneth Branagh is Lee Simon, a media obsessed journalist who is obsessed with celebrities and whose one aim in life is to bed as many famous media people as he can. This surprisingly light hearted satire by famous misanthrope, Woody Allen, sends up the lavish decadence of the famous and our perennial fascination with their sex lives and bad habits. Many Hollywood stars play themselves or versions of themselves, including a hilarious cameo by Leonardo Di Caprio as a self-obsessed drug addled superstar. Judy Davis plays Lee’s long suffering wife, who can’t compete with the famous starlets who come Lee’s way, and Branagh himself is excellent in a role which sees him spookily take on Woody Allen’s persona and quirks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Woody Allen, Jean Doumanian, Magnolia Productions and Sweetland Films BV

results.title: Celebrations of people and place : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: The East Reservoir Neighbourhood Renewal was set up in 2006 when the area was identified as being in need and enabling residents to help create a community action plan. Part of this process has been to invite seven members of the community to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop to tell very personal stories the reflect life in the suburb.

results.title: Celebration: the Larwill Tapestry
results.brief_description: Established by the State Government of Victoria in 1976, the Victorian Tapestry Workshop has garnered itself an international reputation as a leader in the industry. In 1999 the Government decided to present a gift to the new Singapore Esplanade Theatre and visual artist David Larwill was selected to create a design that would be turned into a tapestry. This documentary covers the process of creating the tapestry, warping the loom, dying the wool, hitching on, interpreting the artwork, hitching off and the cutting off ceremony. Includes a biography of the artist and his work, as well as a brief spiel on the artist exchange program involving 3 Singapore artists, culminating in an exhibition at the Victorian College of the Arts. Sue Walker, Director, Victorian Tapestry Workshop is also interviewed on her involvement in the project.

results.title: Celebration!: 40 years of Australian opera
results.creator_credit: Peter Butler and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This video celebrates 40 years of the association between ABC Television and the Australian Opera. The best performers, conducters, designers assemble in a gala performance. Unique archival footage from an early production of Mozart’s “The Marriage of Figaro” staged in 1960, to the more recent production of “La Boheme” by Baz Luhrmann is featured. Some of the performers are Dame Joan Sutherland, Donald Smith, Neil Warren-Smith, John Shaw, Joan Carden, Yvonne Kenny and Jeffrey Black.

results.title: Celebration of the senses: a profile of Eric Rolls
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Looks at the life, work and world of Eric Rolls through his senses. He reads from his own writings and shows how he uses the senses in descriptive narrative. Describes the way in which he senses the world with hearing, sight, taste, smell and touch.

results.title: Celebration of life: trees
results.creator_credit: Paul Fillinger and Paul Fillinger Productions
results.brief_description: The beauty and wonder of our natural environment gives cause for a celebration. The viewer joins a group of youngsters discovering and enjoying everything about trees and forests. It is a reminder of the people-nature activities that can be enjoyed. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Celebration of a nation
results.brief_description: Produced to celebrate Australia’s bicentenary in 1988, this short picture postcard presents images of Australia’s distinct landscape, flora and fauna, new Australian’s sharing their experiences, archival footage of the colonial era and Australian’s at war, natural disasters, and footage of the entertainment industry; music, dance, performance and radio. The soundtrack is a combination of Australian rock as well as instrumental “patriotic” songs.
